sense.name: apply or employ something for a purpose
sense.commentary: Syntax is: NP[agent] USE NP[instrument] PP[purpose]
sense.examples: Don't use a natural bristle brush with latex paint. He used Sally to land that job. The defense will use the argument of self defense. Mary uses her pawns well in chess offense strategies. Options can be used as a hedge against unfavorable stock price movements.

sense.name: consume or ingest,usually habitually
sense.examples: John used cocaine on the job. Can those athletes use steroids legally? Mary is using birth control pills.

sense.name: expend a quantity
sense.commentary: Syntax is: NP USE (ADJ)[quant] NOUN Note: implies NOUN decreases, disappears over time. Includes: USE UP
sense.examples: Please don't use all the toothpaste. The commitee used all their time discussing the rezoning issue, and nothing else. That rocket will use more oxygen during liftoff than you'll breathe in a lifetime. As the battery is used up, its output voltage falls. Those meetings used up three hours of my time.

sense.name: act customarily or regularly
sense.commentary: Syntax is: NP1 USED to V1 NP2
sense.examples: We used to surf in Santa Cruz. He used to have a drinking problem. Her cat used to scratch the draperies.
